18155511.theme: Other financial and private sector development,International financial standards and systems,Regulation and competition policy,Macroeconomic management,Debt management and fiscal sustainability
18155511.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Economic management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Economic Recovery Credit will
            provide support for the Government's Economic and
            Social Rehabilitation Program.  The objectives of the credit
            are to support macroeconomic stabilization through the
            strengthening of key elements of fiscal and monetary policy
            while supporting an interlinked program of enterprise and
            financial sector reform.  The credit has four components.
            First, it will support the development of integrated
            sectoral programs in the three key areas of agriculture,
            health and education.  Second, the program supports the
            central bank in its key central banking functions of
            monetary policy management, banking supervision, legal
            development, accounting - while continuing the strengthening
            and the streamlining of the foreign exchange management and
            allocation process.  Third, the program supports the
            development of a competitive, efficiently functioning, and
            truly commercial banking system.  New banking entry is being
            encouraged and the existing state owned banks are being
            "commercialized" and prepared for privatization.
            Fourth, the program accelerates the privatization program
            with particular attention being paid to the larger state
            owned enterprises within the economy.  In addition to
            privatization, the program supports a review of business
            environment issues which impact adversely upon the
            development of enterprises.
